thread.title: Family friendly: hip-hop cowboys and outdoor adventures

author: chron.com
title: Family friendly: hip-hop cowboys and outdoor adventures
text:

The evening will include a grand entry parade, a calf scramble and appearances by David Mann and the cast of the BET reality series, Ã©ItÃ©­s a Mann World.Ã© When: 7 p.m. Saturday Where: 7902 Fairmont Parkway Tickets: $20; hiphhopcowboy.com
Photo: Courtesy Photo Hip Hop Cowboys Bucking bulls and powerful horses will perform to a... Image 14 of 14 Family friendly: hip-hop cowboys and outdoor adventures 1 / 14 Back to Gallery Savage Garden
Have a wicked good time in this garden of little terrors while discovering the renegades of the botanical world at the Cockrell Butterfly Center in the Houston Museum of Natural Science . These baddies eat meat, defy death and break all the rules. Learn how they grew to be so nasty and why they act the way they do.
When: 9 a.m.-5 p.m. daily through Oct. 31
Where: 5555 Hermann Park Drive
Tickets: $8, $7 for kids; hmns.org
Brazoria County Fair
Aaron Watson and Earl Thomas Conley will be the headliners as the Brazoria County Fair wraps ups this weekend. Festivities include a carnival midway, a beer garden, livestock show and ranch rodeo.
When: 10 a.m.-11 p.m. Thursday and Friday and 8 a.m.-midnight Saturday
Where: 901 S. Downing , Angleton
Tickets: free on Thursday; $15, $5 for kids; brazoriacountyfair.com
Wings Over
Houston
The skies over Ellington Airport will be filled with vintage aircraft this weekend as the Commemorative Air Force presents its Wings Over Houston Airshow. Among the aerial performers will be the U.S. Air Force Thunderbirds , the VFA-122 Super Hornet demonstration team, the Breitling Jet Team and U.S. Coast Guard Helicopter Dolphin team. In addition, there will be stunt planes, sky divers and radio controlled aircraft demonstrations.
When: 8 a.m.-6 p.m. Saturday and 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Sunday
Where: 510 Ellington Field
Tickets: $30; houstonwing.org
East End Street Fest
Los Skarnales and La Fiebre are among the entertainers for the East End Street Fest. The event will include two stages of entertainment, family activities and plenty of food options.
When: Noon-9 p.m. Saturday
Where: Navigation, between Jensen and Delano streets
Tickets: $8 at the gate, free for ages 12 and younger; eastendstreetfest.com
Hip-Hop Cowboys
Bucking bulls and powerful horses will perform to a soundtrack of hip-hop, rap and blues at this event at the Pasadena Convention Center and Fairgrounds that melds urban music with cowboy culture. The evening will include a grand entry parade, a calf scramble and appearances by David Mann and the cast of the BET reality series, "It's a Mann World."
When: 7 p.m. Saturday
Where: 7902 Fairmont
Tickets: $20; hiphhopcowboy.com
Monsters' Museum
Each year at this time the Children's Museum of Houston is transformed into the Monsters' Museum of Houston. Activities may include frightening fashion shows, howling demonstrations and pumpkin painting. And from 4-6 p.m. daily (4-8 p.m. Thursdays), there will be trick-or-treating.
When: 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Tuesdays-Saturdays, noon-6 p.m. Sundays (extended hours Thursdays)
Where: 1500 Binz
Tickets: $10; free admission 5-8 p.m. Thursdays; cmhouston.org
Howl-O-Ween
Pups will be strutting their stuff at the Howl-O-Ween Dog Walk, Costume Contest & Expo at LaCenterra at Cinco Ranch. The event includes a one-mile noncompetitive walk and a costume contest with prizes. The first 200 participants will receive a commemorative T-shirt, and refreshments will be available for dogs and owners. Proceeds will benefit Citizens for Animal Protection.
When: 8-11 a.m. Saturday
Where: 23501 Cinco Ranch, Katy
Registration: $35 at gate; cap4pets.org
Corn mazes & fall festivals
Several local farms are offering fall festivities that include corn mazes, hay rides and other family-friendly games. Some activities may require an additional fee.
Dewberry Farm: 10 a.m.-dusk Saturdays and noon-dusk Sundays, through Nov. 8; $12; 7705 FM 362, Brookshire; dewberryfarm.com
Froberg's Farm: 9 a.m.-6 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays, through Nov. 8; $10, $8 for ages 3-12; 3601 W. Texas 6, Alvin; frobergsfarm.com
P-6 Farms: 10 a.m.-8 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays through October; $10.50; 9963 Poole's Road, Montgomery; p-6farms.com
